data.title: Gorizia and Nova Gorica featured in The Guardian
data.meta_description: The Guardian published an article today about Gorizia and Nova Gorica, twin border towns reunited in Italy and Slovenia as European capitals of culture. (ANSA)
data.text:
The Guardian published an article today about Gorizia and Nova Gorica, twin border towns reunited in Italy and Slovenia as European capitals of culture. Gorizia was divided in 1947 between Italy and Slovenia, and the two towns will reunite next year as the European Capital of Culture, according to the newspaper. From February 2025, an ambitious programme of 600 diverse events - including music, dance, art, theatre, cinema, sport, fashion, ecology, and cuisine - will reflect this "borderless" theme.

The article emphasises that "Gorizia is one of those rare hidden gems that is simply not on the radar of most tourists, or even most Italians," and lists a number of tourist destinations on both sides of the border.
